extendedIngredients.name: fresh mozzarella cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 12 ounces fresh mozzarella cheese, thinly sliced

title: Pesto Arugula Wraps
summary: Pesto Arugula Wraps is a vegetarian condiment. This recipe serves 8 and costs $1.34 per serving. One portion of this dish contains approximately 11g of protein, 21g of fat, and a total of 251 calories. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. If you have lightly arugula, lahvosh flatbread, pesto, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 15 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 36%, this dish is not so super. Similar recipes include Arugula Pesto: Pesto Di Rucola, Egg Salad, Arugula & Bacon Wraps, and Apple-arugula Salad Wraps.
instructions: Lay lahvosh on a work surface with longest sides parallel to surface edge and smooth, lighter sides up. Spread each with 1/2 cup pesto. On each sheet, place half of cheese slices on two-thirds of pesto, leaving 2 in. uncovered at top edge for sealing. Cover cheese with arugula. Starting with bottom edge, roll up each lahvosh and press to seal edge, securing with toothpicks if needed.                                                                                                 Slice each roll into 1-in. pieces, remove toothpicks if used, and arrange on a platter. Makes about 32 pieces.                                                                                                *Substitute 4 flour tortillas (10 in. wide).                                                                                                Note: Nutritional analysis is per appetizer serving.

steps.step: Lay lahvosh on a work surface with longest sides parallel to surface edge and smooth, lighter sides up.

Spread each with 1/2 cup pesto. On each sheet, place half of cheese slices on two-thirds of pesto, leaving 2 in. uncovered at top edge for sealing. Cover cheese with arugula. Starting with bottom edge, roll up each lahvosh and press to seal edge, securing with toothpicks if needed.
Slice each roll into 1-in. pieces, remove toothpicks if used, and arrange on a platter. Makes about 32 pieces.
